Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of a building.
Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to reach his apartment on the 10th floor.
However, on rainy days and when there are other people in the elevator, he goes directly to the 10th floor.

Why does he normally get off on the 7th floor? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why the man on the 10th floor takes the elevator down to the 7th floor every morning instead of going directly to the ground floor.
Let me break this down step by step.
First, I know that he lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
That part makes sense because he needs to leave the building.
But in the evening, after work, he takes the elevator back up to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.

Hmm, why not just go straight back up to the 10th floor?

Wait, but the question also mentions that on rainy days and when there are other people in the elevator, he goes directly to the 10th floor.
So, normally, he doesn't go all the way up.
That makes me think there's something about the elevator's behavior that affects his stops.
Let me consider the elevator's possible rules or limitations.
Maybe the elevator doesn't go all the way to the 10th floor during certain times or under certain conditions.
For example, perhaps on rainy days or when there are other people, the elevator goes faster or stops at the 10th floor, but normally, it only goes up to the 7th floor.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator has a limit.
Like, it only goes up to the 7th floor unless it's raining or there are people in it.
So, when it's not raining and there aren't others, it stops at 7, but when those conditions are met, it goes all the way.
Wait, that doesn't quite add up.

If the elevator normally stops at 7, why does it go further on rainy days or with people? Maybe the opposite: perhaps the elevator normally doesn't stop at 10, but when it's raining or crowded, it does.
So, the man takes the elevator down to ground floor in the morning, but in the evening, if it's not raining and there aren't others, it stops at 7, and he walks up.
But if it's raining or crowded, it goes to 10 directly.
But the question is why he normally gets off at 7.
So, normally, the elevator doesn't go to 10, but when it does, it's because of the conditions.
So, the man takes the elevator down every morning, but in the evening, if the elevator is empty or it's not raining, it stops at 7, and he walks up.
Otherwise, it goes all the way to 10.
Wait, but the problem says he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up.
So, normally, the elevator goes to 7, but when it's rainy or there are people, it goes to 10.
So, why does it stop at 7 normally? Maybe the elevator has a rule where it doesn't go beyond the 7th floor unless certain conditions are met, like rain or crowded.
So, when those conditions aren't met, it stops at 7, and he has to walk up.
Alternatively, perhaps the elevator's maximum stop is the 7th floor, so unless it's raining or there are people, it doesn't go higher.
So, he takes it down in the morning, but in the evening, if the conditions aren't met, it stops at 7, and he walks up.
But when it's raining or crowded, it goes all the way to 10.
Wait, that makes sense.
So, the elevator has a setting where it only goes up to the 7th floor unless it's raining or there are people in it.
So, the man takes it down every morning to the ground floor, and in the evening, if it's not raining and there aren't others, it stops at 7, and he walks up.
But if it's raining or there are people, it goes directly to 10.
So, the reason he normally gets off at 7 is because the elevator doesn't go beyond that unless it's raining or crowded.
Therefore, the elevator's normal behavior is to stop at 7, but it goes higher when certain conditions are met.
I think that's the key.
The elevator has a limit, and under normal circumstances, it doesn't go beyond the 7th floor, so he has to walk up from there.
But when it's raining or there are other people, it goes all the way to 10.
So, the answer is that the elevator stops at the 7th floor normally, but on rainy days or when there are people, it goes to the 10th floor.
Therefore, he gets off at 7 because that's where the elevator stops under normal conditions.

</think>

The man normally gets off at the 7th floor because the elevator only goes up to that floor under normal conditions.
On rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, it goes directly to the 10th floor.
Therefore, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.
